poem:
Title: The Absence Between Clashes

Broken, the silence of the Persians,
under the roiling indigo canvas.
Iron birds sing the sound of thunder,
over Isfahan and Tabriz's slumber.
O, the pencil stub of the scribe,
who traces lines in shrinking light,
his ink but a shadow in absence.
Look, Washington and Tel Aviv dance,
not of peace, but of stealth and advance;
a woe, not seen by those who glance.
